methodologies.note: To discuss and share the regulation of internship processes and evaluation, including: intern hours, processing documents, experience sharing, and reports.
To join and finish human resource related intern job to work at least for 240 hours in the workplace.
To finish an internship report and share that with faculty and classmates at seminar course.
To earn an evaluation from the intern supervisor with average "agree" level recommendation.

grading.note: To present and share the experiences and implications with others at the class, join the discussion
To follow the IHRD internship guidance
Evaluation form from the intern supervisor and the lecture

prerequisite: ◎Exclusive for students within this department(including dual degree program) ◎Unavailable for M.A. program students (M.A. program courses excepted) and B.A. program students.
